title: `lib/Fn.js` Clean up and Commenting
body:
As the first part of creating some docs for `lib/Fn.js` #1214 , I've added and updated commenting in source. I've also shored up tests, though it was in a pretty good place to start with. At this point, we've got fully 100% coverage.

A few notes:
- I didn't try to meaningfully comment the `fma` function because it's, ah, a bit beyond my grade level.
- I was a tad confused by the behavior of the auto-generated `Fn.u*` functions, which I believe are meant to constrain the passed value to a certain bit size. `Fn.u8(256)` returns `256`. Isn't that a 9-bit number? I may completely not understand what those functions are for, though :).

title: DHT11 connected to GrovePi+
Device or Firmware Error  [updated]
body:
Hi everyone, I'm a new member of github. I've been using Arduino for a year now and I wanted to create a server with the Pi and the UNO. I encountered so many problems maybe because I've bought an OrangePi which is a clone of Raspberry Pi (Yes, I know, i should have bought the original one, but i had to save some money). I' ve installed Debian 8 on it and in order to work with node I also installed  NVM and  I'm currently working with node 6. I installed johnny-five, but it gave me errors regarding serialport; to solve this problem I decided to install serialport without installing johnny-five, but there were errors about node-pre-gyp. So I installed it globally. I started the program called Hello World after uploading StandardFirmata on the arduino (not original either) and after plugging it in one of the  USB ports. The program couldn't start because the cmd was continuously saying "board looking for connected device", the next thing  that I did was looking for the different devices attached to the board and this happened:  
                                                                                                                                                                       `[ { comName: '/dev/ttyS0',
    manufacturer: undefined,
    serialNumber: undefined,
    pnpId: undefined,
    vendorId: undefined,
    productId: undefined },
  { comName: '/dev/ttyS2',
    manufacturer: undefined,
    serialNumber: undefined,
    pnpId: undefined,
    vendorId: undefined,
    productId: undefined },
  { comName: '/dev/ttyS3',
    manufacturer: undefined,
    serialNumber: undefined,
    pnpId: undefined,
    vendorId: undefined,
    productId: undefined } ]`

After struggling so much I decided to change the code by defining the port . 
I tried all the three ports and the cmd always said:  

`1472576273960 Connected /dev/ttyS3
1472576283987 Device or Firmware Error A timeout occurred while connecting to the Board.

Please check that you've properly flashed the board with the correct firmware.
See: https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/wiki/Getting-Started#trouble-shooting

If connecting to a Leonardo or Leonardo clone, press the 'Reset' button on the board, wait approximately 11 seconds for complete reset, then run your program again.
events.js:165
      throw err;
      ^

Error: Uncaught, unspecified "error" event. ([object Object])
    at Board.emit (events.js:163:17)
    at Board.log (/root/node_modules/johnny-five/lib/board.js:625:8)
    at Board.(anonymous function) [as error](/root/node_modules/johnny-five/lib/board.js:636:14)
    at Board.<anonymous> (/root/node_modules/johnny-five/lib/board.js:385:14)
    at tryOnTimeout (timers.js:232:11)
    at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:202:5)`

Thank you for the help. :)

title: How to use Johnny-Five with Cluster?
body:
Well, hello there! I'd like to know how can I use johnny-five with cluster module of NodeJS?
Reason is, sometimes I get a lot uncaughtExceptions from the library and I'm unable to handle them properly (e.g if sensor dies on a pin (DS18B20) it throws up error device not found).

Second, I added DHT11 feature in ConfigurableFirmata sketch (https://github.com/taoyuan/Firmata/tree/master/examples/DHT11Firmata). For personal reason, I can't use additional I2C devices for each sensor. So when it dies (or disconnected, whatever) the library does a lot of loop conditions (loopCnt = 10000) which causes ConfigurableFirmata to freeze, thus johnny-five can't work with it too for a while (in my case, I'm reading in loop DS18B20 sensor data, but when sketch is 'frozen', it throws up uncaughtException and asking if I'm using OneWire on ConfigurableFirmata).

I also thought about domains, but sadly it's deprecated and getting removed anytime soon.

Any thoughts?

title: How to use DHT11Feature?
Mismatched Module Version when attempting to build against Electron
body:
After rebuilding electron using `./node_modules/.bin/electron-rebuild` I get the error: `Module version mismatch: Expected 49, got 48`. I tried running `./node_modules/.bin/electron-rebuild -n 48`, as well as `./node_modules/.bin/electron-rebuild -n 49`, but neither worked.

I've attempted using the `rm -rf node_modules/` method, then running `npm install; ./node_modules/.bin/electron-rebuild`, and I've even tried force clearing the npm cache with no luck.

At the moment I'm using an Arduino Uno, but will soon be switching to a Micro. As far as usage of Johnny-five goes, I'm only trying to initialize a board when electron loads (within the `app.on('ready', function...)` for electron's API). My electron app is a tray/status bar app, so johnny-five is being used in the `main` process of electron, not the `render`.

```
node: v6.3.1
electron: v1.3.3
npm: v3.10.3
johnny-five: ^0.10.0
```

**EDIT 1**: After reading some of the code [here](https://github.com/sofroniewn/electron-johnny-five-examples), I believe this may be a problem oriented around me trying to use johnny five from the electron `main` process.

body:
Hi! I have always found the optional `Boolean` parameter for jQuery's [toggle](http://api.jquery.com/toggle/#toggle-display) method quite handy and occasionally wish it existed on `Led` (and `Led.RGB`, etc.). That is, if a Boolean argument is present, `toggle` sets the component to that state. This can be useful for simplifying logic.

I'd be happy to implement, test and PR if this is something that would be a good idea.

title: Board : BeagleBone Black - Trouble : Build/Install errors
labels: [{'id': 429783642, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw0Mjk3ODM2NDI=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/IO-Plugin', 'name': 'IO-Plugin', 'color': 'bfd4f2', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 73076245, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw3MzA3NjI0NQ==', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Needs%20Attention', 'name': 'Needs Attention', 'color': 'e11d21', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 429791230, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw0Mjk3OTEyMzA=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Needs%20Info', 'name': 'Needs Info', 'color': 'b60205', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 1030931292, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMDMwOTMxMjky', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/stale', 'name': 'stale', 'color': 'ffffff', 'default': False, 'description': None}]
body:
**I have simply done the following actions, in the order given. I will explain in detail all steps because it gives an MCVE (Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable Example) :**
1. On my Linux desktop, in order to put the image (downloaded from the [official website](https://debian.beagleboard.org/images/bone-debian-8.4-lxqt-4gb-armhf-2016-05-13-4gb.img.xz)) on my SD card : 
   `xzcat bone-debian-8.4-lxqt-4gb-armhf-2016-05-13-4gb.img.xz | sudo dd of=/dev/mmcblk0`
   `sudo sync`
2. On the first boot of my BeagleBone Black, resizing partition :
   `sudo fdisk /dev/mmcblk0`
   `d`
   `2`
   `n`
   `p`
   `2`
   ` `
   ` `
   `w`
   `sudo shutdown -r now`
   `sudo resize2fs /dev/mmcblk0p2`
   `sudo shutdown -r now`
3. Updating / Upgrading
   `sudo apt-get update`
   `sudo apt-get upgrade`
4. Updating to Node.js 4.x (as proposed [here](http://johnny-five.io/#hello-world)) :
   `sudo su`
   `curl -sL https://deb.nodesource.com/setup_4.x | bash -`
   `apt-get install -y nodejs`
   `exit`
5. Installing Johnny-Five in a development directory : 
   `sudo su`
   `cd /var/lib/cloud9`
   `mkdir elec`
   `cd elec`
   `npm install johnny-five`

**Some notes on these steps :**
- On point 1 : I also tried with this image : bone-debian-7.11-lxde-4gb-armhf-2016-06-15-4gb.img.xz but it fails in the same way.
- On point 4 : I also tried with Node.js v0.12, v5.x and v6.x, but they fail in the same way.

**What I receive from point 5 :**
[npm_i_j5.txt](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/files/423640/npm_i_j5.txt)

**Moreover, when I go to node_modules, this is what `ls` gives me :**
`accepts              debug                 johnny-five        repl
after                depd                  json3              request
ansi-regex           destroy               lodash.clonedeep   send
ansi-styles          ease-component        lodash.debounce    serialport

**That is why I am wondering... is my install correct? The fact is that after, when I try to do :**
`npm install beaglebone-io`
**It fails like described [here](https://github.com/julianduque/beaglebone-io/issues/25#issuecomment-240524997) and bring me to not be able to use Johnny-Five and that, from what I have read, is really sad because this project seems really promising and I am really enthusiastic to use it, promote it, contribute to it! Can someone help me?**

title: Documentation for i2cConfig is incorrect/confusing
body:
If we look at the documentation for i2cConfig() found here:

http://johnny-five.io/api/board/

We find that its documented signature is:

`i2cConfig([milliseconds])`

while when we look here:

https://github.com/rwaldron/io-plugins

We see that the signature of i2cConfig() is:

`i2cConfig(options)`

with a rich set of options available.  This issue asks for examination and consolidation of docs.  I would have attempted consolidation myself, but I was unable to find any git source for the public web site pages.

title: Connecting multiple boards to J5 - Issues
body:
We are attempting to connect 2 boards to J5 via ethernet over 2 ports (3015 & 3016). 

**Scenario 1:** 
When both the boards are connected, the board on port 3016 ( 2nd board) is not responding. But board on 3015 (1st board) is working as expected. We are not sure what is happening internally.

**Scenario 2:**
When we have board 1 powered Off and have board 2 On, the board is not getting instantiated, and throwing the following error 

`Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'type' of null`

We are trying to understand the following as to what is happening in both the cases above.

**What do we actually want?**
a. We need multiple boards to be able to connect to J5 independently with out intervention from other boards.
b. We are using the 'boards' object, where if one of the boards errors out leading to application crashing. This is a very practical problem for our solution design where when the application crashes our whole solution will come down leading to massive losses. 

Please suggest a solution out for this.

body:
Hi all,

I'm looking to use my Arduino's TX and RX pins to communicate to a Raspberry Pi using a radio transceiver that I bought.  I was looking around the docs for firmata.js and I found [this](https://github.com/firmata/firmata.js/#serial) which seems to imply that I should be able to do this.

After looking through the j5 docs, it doesn't look like this is officially supported yet (please correct me if I'm wrong here).  So I guess my question is - Is there a good way to gain access to the underlying firmata instance that j5 uses so I can have access to `board.serialWrite` or its friends?

Alternatively, is there a better way to approach something like this?

Thanks!

title: No data when reading light from the TSL2561 (RPI 2g, Arduino Uno)
body:
Greetings,

I am experimenting with an Adafruit TSL2561 sensor but are not able to get any light values.

I have the current setup; RPI with J5, and Arduino Uno connected using USB, running firmata on the Arduino, having the TSL2561 sensor wired with default settings all the way. The sensor i using i2c - default addresses. My experiment is based on the default example for the tsl2561 sensor.

Testing that I have done:
- I have tested the Arduino & the wiring accessing the sensor from the Arduino ide. This works fines. I am getting good readings.
- I have tested the RPI->J5->Arduino->Firmata link by hooking some simle leds. This works fine, J5 talks to the Arduino and controls the leds.
- I have followed the J5 code from the light.js-> into firmata.js and can see that the tsl2561 code for initializing is running and that i2c calls are made from firmata for setting up the sensor. This looks ok; the sensor respons on the default address as expected, timing and gain messages are sendt into the i2c bus and the code for read executed.  This where things are stopping now.

In the light.js code i have tried setting the frequency of the sensor and using the on("data") event. The data that is returned is always [0,0,0,0]. The on("change") event never triggers.

Putting it briefly - I am not getting values back from the sensor - as far as I can see that is :)

I have done some debugging, but it getting quite complex with callbacks on callbacks, events and emitters, i2C over firmata - so any guidance would be appreciated.

body:
A really strange problem, I can successfully run a nw.js application to control my Arduino car by using johnny-five framework on my own computer, but when I move the packaged app to others' computers, the car would not work any more. The nw.js app would not be able to connect to the car via Bluetooth adapter.

I can be sure that the usb driver for Arduino UNO has been installed correctly on others' computer, and the devices manager can find the Bluetooth devices with Arduino UNO COM*. I don't know what's the problem behind this, and I guess the environment of others' computers might not be complete for running johnny-five (vs c++ ? or other ... I don't know actually). Can anyone give me the exact answer of what is the complete environment that johnny-five relying on, or show me the solution to solve this problem? Thanks.

title: Unable to switch an AC Contactor via Relay
body:
Here is the following scenario

**Setup:**
We are using Atmega644 PA-AU and trying to drive AC Contactors via relays. The relays are based on Johnny-five Relay Class through StandardFirmataEthernetPlus.

ATMega644 (StandardFirmataEhternetPlus + UIPEthernet) ==> ENC28J60 ==> network ==> PC ( J5 + NodeJs + Electorn)

**Problem:** 
Please refer the attached schematic as the basis of our setup
![relay-contactor_schem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4224024/16758099/5c0da44e-482d-11e6-88ef-87dcbc0be411.jpg)

When we are driving just the relay without AC Loads mentioned at the end of the schematic it works fine with out any issues. As soon as we connect this relay to drive an AC contactor the behavior is erratic meaning the relay works for a few times and stops working with the corresponding leds (led1 and led2 ) hanging up. This also is leading to a MCU freeze.

**Observations:**
H/w and S/w disconnect: We are sending an on()/off() via console of Electron to the Relays. When AC is **NOT** connected the Relays status and the corresponding leds status is in sync. Now with AC Contactor connected to the Relays, the whole setup goes out of sync randomly after any number of ons/offs. Any action via browser does not affect the MCUs status. This is leading us to assume that the MCU is freezing.     

As long as the AC load is not connected the system works flawlessly forever. When ever the AC load is connected malfunction occurs. Not sure why. 

**Questions:**
1. Is there any thing abnormal in the schematic or connectivity that we have used?
2. Do you think the AC load is causing the MCU freeze up?
3. How do we know/test if J5 is alive?
4. Are we missing some thing here?

**NOTE:
The same setup is working perfectly with Arduino UNO+Ehternet shield.**

title: Restore handling of 0 value
body:
Was preparing for NBD and found that blink() did not work on Tessel 2 because pin mode was PWM and we weren't handling cases of `state.value === 0` for that.

This situation arises in experiment 1 of the guide for J5IK.

title: Blink is not working
body:
I think [this change](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blame/master/lib/led/led.js#L235-L237) broke blink. For that matter any call to on() after off() has been called once won't work.

blink() calls toggle(), toggle() calls off(), off() sets state.value = 0.

PR on the way. Will also add a test for this.

title: Docs: ESC definition
body: Trivial, but could trip up a beginner: The ESC docs (http://johnny-five.io/api/esc/) don't ever define what ESC is (like, stands for or does). Could be accomplished in a sentence or two. Happy to help if you like!

New Library Created "Flow"
body:
Hi, I needed to add flow meters to my Home Automation, so I decided to create my own library and added to Johnny Five. I know is not elegant, thats why I would like some of you guys to review it and maybe you can add more stuff to it. For now is working fine and its giving me the water usage in real time on my website.

`var flowmeters  = new five.Flow({ pin: 2, board: this.byId("F")}); // Flow Meter Model YF-S201
![water-flow-sensor-meter-yf-s201](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9356338/16370751/6f6e1148-3bff-11e6-8f13-1e69bf8f569a.jpg)
`

and then ...

`io.on('connection', function (socket) {`
`flowmeters.on("open",  function(sensor, data) {`
`water_usage++;`
`total_liters = water_usage/(7.5*60);`
`console.log("Water Usage: " + total_liters.toFixed(2));`
`socket.emit ('water_changed', total_liters.toFixed(2));`
`});`
`});`

All I did was save a copy of the existing library called Switch.js and modify some lines. I also mofified the file johnny-five.js and added 

`Flow: require("./flow"), // Added by Alfredo Borrero`
`module.exports.Flows = module.exports.Flow.Collection; // Added by Alfredo Borrero`

However I now it need some modifications like adding Flow Meter model, there are few of them and every model has their own formula to calculate the flow. I also would like to add outputs via emit() like:
- "Pulses"
- "Total Liters"
- "Liters per minute"
- "Gallons per minute"
- "Liters per hour"
- "Gallons per hour"

I know Johnny Five was originally intended for Robots, perhaps someone wants do design a robot to fill up a water tank? or a gas tank? ... Anyways I have been using Johnny Five for a while for my Home Automation and its working very very well, congrats !!!. Every day I add new devices to my house and Johnny Five is handling it very well. I hope some of you guys can add this library to Johnny Five.

Regards,

Alfredo Borrero

[flow.zip](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/files/334210/flow.zip)

title: ADXL345 sensitivity values incorrect?
body:
While reading the code for the ADXL345 in accelerometer.js (and looking for inspiration for ADXL345 tap detection :)) I saw the following code related to the [sensitivity values](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/accelerometer.js#L197-L221):

``` js
        /*
          Page 4
          Sensitivity at             XOUT  YOUT ZOUT
          2 g, 10-bit resolution     230   256  282
          4 g, 10-bit resolution     115   128  141
          8 g, 10-bit resolution      57    64   71
          16 g, 10-bit resolution     29    32   35
        */
        state.sensitivity = [{
          x: 230,
          y: 256,
          z: 282
        }, {
          x: 115,
          y: 128,
          z: 141
        }, {
          x: 57,
          y: 64,
          z: 71
        }, {
          x: 29,
          y: 32,
          z: 35
        }][range];
```

This code assume that the three sensitivity values show for each resolution in the [datasheet](http://www.analog.com/media/en/technical-documentation/data-sheets/ADXL345.pdf) are individual values for each of the x, y, and z axes. If I'm not mistaken, the three values shown are Min, Typ, and Max values that are the same for each axis:

``` js
        /*
          Page 4
          Sensitivity at              Min   Typ  Max
          2 g, 10-bit resolution     230   256  282
          4 g, 10-bit resolution     115   128  141
          8 g, 10-bit resolution      57    64   71
          16 g, 10-bit resolution     29    32   35
        */
```

title: Raspberry Pi 2 + Raspbian Jessie (2016-05-10) + J5
body:
I'm quite not sure if this is the right place but I'm running in some problems
triying to install J5 in Raspian. So I wrote down my findings, maybe they are
helpfull.

I've downloaded the latest version of Raspbian (2016-05-10), wrote the image
to a 8GB sdcard and put it in my Raspberry Pi 2. Then I tried to follow the
tutorial "Getting started with Raspberry Pi node red and IoT" on GitHub.

https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/wiki/Getting-started-with-Raspberry-Pi-node-red-and-IoT

I followed the tutorial and installed npm with apt-get

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ sudo apt-get update
cpranzl@loki:~ $ sudo apt-cache show npm | grep Version
Version: 1.4.21+ds-2
cpranzl@loki:~ $ sudo apt-get install npm
cpranzl@loki:~ $ npm --version
1.4.21
```

This will correctly lead to npm 1.4.21 but I wanted to use version 2.15.1 of npm so I used

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ sudo npm install -g npm@2.15.1
/usr/bin/npm -> /usr/lib/node_modules/npm/bin/npm-cli.js
npm@2.15.1 /usr/lib/node_modules/npm
cpranzl@loki:~ $ npm --version
2.15.1
```

Next step is to check on the installed NodeJS version.

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ nodejs --version
v.0.10.29
```

Finally I was able to start installing the johnny-five and raspi-io packages

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ npm i johnny-five raspi-io
...

...
Disabling serial port login at boot time, you may be asked for your password
Checking if serial port login is enabled
Serial port login does not appear to be enabled, skipping
johnny-five@0.9.49 node_modules/johnny-five
 ease-component@1.0.0
 lodash.debounce@4.0.6
 color-convert@1.2.2
 browser-serialport@2.0.3
 temporal@0.5.0
 lodash.clonedeep@4.3.2 (lodash._baseclone@4.5.7)
 chalk@1.1.3 (escape-string-regexp@1.0.5, supports-color@2.0.0, ansi-styles@2.2.1, strip-ansi@3.0.1, has-ansi@2.0.0)
 nanotimer@0.3.10

 es6-shim@0.35.1
 serialport@3.1.2 (bindings@1.2.1, es6-promise@3.2.1, commander@2.9.0, debug@2.2.0, object.assign@4.0.3, nan@2.3.3)

raspi-io@6.0.1 node_modules/raspi-io
 raspi-board@3.0.0
 raspi-led@1.3.2 (raspi-peripheral@1.5.2)
 raspi@2.0.0 (raspi-wiringpi@1.0.6, nan@2.3.3)
 raspi-pwm@3.0.0 (raspi-peripheral@1.5.2, nan@2.3.3)
 raspi-gpio@2.2.2 (raspi-peripheral@1.5.2, nan@2.3.3)
 raspi-i2c@3.0.0 (ini-builder@1.0.3, raspi-peripheral@1.5.2, i2c-bus@1.0.3)
 raspi-serial@1.3.1 (raspi-peripheral@1.5.2, serialport@2.1.2)
```

Controlling if all went in the right place

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ ls -al
total 52
drwxr-xr-x  5 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 19 06:17 .
drwxr-xr-x  4 root    root    4096 May 17 19:57 ..
-rw-------  1 cpranzl cpranzl  596 May 19 06:12 .bash_history
-rw-r--r--  1 cpranzl cpranzl  220 May 17 19:57 .bash_logout
-rw-r--r--  1 cpranzl cpranzl 3697 May 17 20:03 .bashrc
drwxr-xr-x  3 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:15 .node-gyp
drwxr-xr-x  4 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:15 node_modules
drwxr-xr-x 52 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:19 .npm
-rw-r--r--  1 cpranzl cpranzl  675 May 17 19:57 .profile
-rw-r--r--  1 cpranzl cpranzl  795 May 17 20:04 .tmux.conf
cpranzl@loki:~ $ cd node_modules
cpranzl@loki:~/node_modules $ ls -al
total 16
drwxr-xr-x 4 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:15 .
drwxr-xr-x 5 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 19 06:17 ..
drwxr-xr-x 4 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:15 johnny-five
drwxr-xr-x 4 cpranzl cpranzl 4096 May 17 20:15 raspi-io
```

Looks good, so reverting to my home-directory I started a new file and wrote the first JScript

```
cpranzl@loki:~/node_modules $ cd ..
cpranzl@loki:~ $ nano raspi-io.js

00 var five = require("johnny-five");
01 var Raspi = require("raspi-io");
02 var board = new five.Board({
03     io: new Raspi()
04 });
05
06 board.on("ready", function() {
07     var led = new five.Led("P1-13");
08     led.blink();
09 });
```

Then I started the script

```
cpranzl@loki:~ $ node raspi-io.js

/home/cpranzl/node_modules/raspi-io/node_modules/raspi-i2c/lib/index.js:96
var devices = Symbol('devices');

at Module._compile (module.js:456:26)
at Object.Module._extensions..js (module.js:474:10)
```

Where is my error or did i forgot something? Any suggestions?

title: Adding Tolerance on temperature changes for "thermometer.js" library
body:
Line 964 in "thermometer.js" is emitting changes in the temperature whether the change is small or big. 

I would like to see a new variable added the the library called TOLERANCE, then the user can specify what type of change in temperature needs to be emitted to the connected clients. Sometimes the variable "**last**" has a value of 24.14 C and "**this.celsius**" has a value of 24.15 C ; to be honest with you, that is pretty much the same temperature (not worth emitting to the client) unless I specify a small tolerance, eg:  TOLERANCE = 0.01 

Lets say I am using sensors for Home Automation.  For my particular uses, there is no difference between 24.14 C and 24.15 C because I will show 24 C and  I can convert the number to an integer.  However, the node will be emitting changes that are not needed, and using resources that can be used for other sensors. 

I think if we add a TOLERANCE variable, the library will be more flexible for users. I had to modify the library in order to introduce tolerance, then reduced the unnecessary amount of messages emitted from the server to the connected clients.  

```
964)    if (this.celsius !== last) {
965)      last = this.celsius;
966)      this.emit("change", data);
967)    }
```

This tolerance can be specified by the user like this: 
`var temp = new five.Thermometer({ pin: 3, controller: "DS18B20", tol: 0.5  });`
as another field in the opts object

Of course this can be added to any other library library like "**lights.js**"

Let me know your thoughts ...

Regards,

Alfredo Borrero

title: ADXL345 accelerometer - Problems of bit addresses
body:
Hi,

With @tournevis we use an [ADXL345 accelerometer](https://www.amazon.fr/SODIAL-ADXL345-Digital-Acceleration-dinclinaison/dp/B00KBPR3E0?ie=UTF8&creative=22698&creativeASIN=B00KBPR3E0&hvdev=c&hvnetw=g&hvqmt=&linkCode=df0&ref_=asc_df_B00KBPR3E033810549&tag=googshopfr-21) and we discover a largely known problem about the Z-axis value. One of solutions (except buying another model) is to changing the range of the accelerometer like they say into this two topics :
- [Forum Arduino - Problem with adxl345 3-axis accelerometer](http://forum.arduino.cc/index.php?topic=101845.0)

>  The arduino code I am using (Razor_AHRS) initializes the accelerometer for range +-2g. By switching to +-16 g mode (writing 0x0B instead of 0x08 to register 0x31), I was able to get unclipped reading from Z axis.
- [Avrfreaks - ADXL345 Accelerometer Z-axis not working](http://www.avrfreaks.net/forum/adxl345-accelerometer-z-axis-not-working)

> I changed the range to +- 16 g and that seemed to solve the problem.

And it works fine for us.

Now, we pass to Firmata using jhonny-five and we discover the same trouble using the [ADXL345 example](http://johnny-five.io/examples/accelerometer-adxl345/) :

```
  x            :  -0.22
  y            :  -0.53
  z            :  2.04
--------------------------------------
  x            :  -0.18
  y            :  -0.51
  z            :  2.04
```

The Z-axis never change and it's not possible to calibrate the range. 

Then, when we look `johnny-five/accelerometer.js` (exactly [l.129-130](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/accelerometer.js#L129-L130)) we found mistakes into the bit adresses. According to the [i2cdevlib/ADXL345](https://github.com/jrowberg/i2cdevlib/tree/master/Arduino/ADXL345) arduino library, good adresses are : 

```
#define ADXL345_ADDRESS_ALT_LOW     0x53 // alt address pin low (GND)
#define ADXL345_ADDRESS_ALT_HIGH    0x1D // alt address pin high (VCC)
....
#define ADXL345_RA_DATA_FORMAT      0x31
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAX0           0x32
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAX1           0x33
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAY0           0x34
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAY1           0x35
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAZ0           0x36
#define ADXL345_RA_DATAZ1           0x37
....
#define ADXL345_RANGE_2G            0b00
#define ADXL345_RANGE_4G            0b01
#define ADXL345_RANGE_8G            0b10
#define ADXL345_RANGE_16G           0b11
...
```

...and into `johnny-five/accelerometer.js` we have : 

```
ADXL345: {
    ADDRESSES: {
      value: [0x53]
    },
    REGISTER: {
      value: {
        POWER: 0x2D,
        RANGE: 0x31,
        READREGISTER: 0x32
      }
    },
```

So the `RANGE` and `READREGISTER` values seems to be wrong. They shift the values completely. This seems to be true because when we are changing adresses, we already have better results : 

```
 RANGE: 0b11,
 READREGISTER: 0x31
```

```
  x            :  -32.36
  y            :  14.12
  z            :  0
--------------------------------------
  x            :  -31.95
  y            :  21.09
  z            :  -1.02
```

But the Z-axis is locked between `0` and `-1.02` and changes into a very little angle. It is not still usable and we think it's because the range value is at  `+-2g`. And when we are adding into our Firmata arduino code the ADXL345 library to calibrate manually the range, the accelerometer works perfectly. 

So, we think there are two problems into the johnny-five support : 
1. The bit adresse `READREGISTER` is wrong.
2. The bit adresse `RANGE` is wrong and in any case never applied.

Hoping to have helped.

title: DMP processed values for MPU6050
labels: [{'id': 348366109, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzNDgzNjYxMDk=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Class:IMU', 'name': 'Class:IMU', 'color': 'fbca04', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 2311916, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwyMzExOTE2', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Enhancement', 'name': 'Enhancement', 'color': '84b6eb', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 370961991, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzNzA5NjE5OTE=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Good%20First%20Issue', 'name': 'Good First Issue', 'color': 'fbca04', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 73075942, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw3MzA3NTk0Mg==', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Hardware%20Required', 'name': 'Hardware Required', 'color': 'eb6420', 'default': False, 'description': None}]
body:
From what I can tell the IMU class only pulls the raw accel/gyro values (as can be observed from the gyro value gradually drifting when sat still). So first up could someone please confirm if this is the case (or it's just something on my end).

If it is the case, It would be a lot more useful if we were provided the calculated fused values supplied by the onboard DMP. This provides much better values than what can be computed manually. It would also make more sense in the context of an _IMU_ since the whole point of one is to provide you with multiple sensors to calculate a better position vs just a convenience wrapper for accel and gyro. I expect the IMU class to provide me data already processed with a complementary/kalman filter or with values returned by the chips onboard processing.

Docs have been published by the manufacturer and there are arduino libraries that use this...

body:
To better understand what needs to be done here, take a look at this example from the `Thermometer` class: 
- https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/thermometer.js#L480-L499

And the corresponding tests: 
- https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/test/thermometer.js#L692

Use the `digits.fractional(value)` function to get the number of fractional digits in a given value.

To better understand what needs to be done here, take a look at this example from the `Thermometer` class: 
- https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/thermometer.js#L480-L499

And the corresponding tests:

title: How To Stop HTU21D Read
Suggested fix for #1113
body: Add "includes" Array.prototype function as a non-enumerable member, https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/issues/1113

title: array-includes-shim.js considered harmful
body: This shim adds the "includes" method to the Array.prototype (used if Array.includes is undefined) as an enumerable property. I think this is bad behaviour as sloppy code in other packages might be affected. For example, if one enumerates keys of an array (not a good idea, I know, but a common mistake) and forgets to check for hasOwnProperty() this may be troublesome. Thus, I think it is better to introduce the method as a non-enumerateble property (or use a third-party shim like [array-includes](https://www.npmjs.com/package/array-includes)  if you prefer). I'll come up with a PR shortly.

title: Using J5 and Modbus protocol?
body:
Hi.

I have an Arduino Yun taking data from 10 pressure sensors through analog pins every 30 seconds , and now I want to read motor consumption but the device uses the modbus protocol to transmit the information.

I am using now J5 and sockets to transmit the sensors information through node-serialport . 

I have read that to use the modbus I have to use a rs485 port so we have to add the IC MAX485. 
There are some implementations of the modbus for node (in npm) that uses node-serialport. 

So, Can I read simultaniously data from the sensors using J5 and the data consumption using modbus? 

I suposse that there should be a sketch with the modbus protocol in the arduino to work with, so then the firmata wouldn't be there, so I suposse I can't do both things using the same arduino. Am I right? 

Thanks

title: Browserify / Webpack support
body:
At a high level, the goal here would be to make requiring `johnny-five` in `package.json` (and perhaps `firmata` and a [`chrome`, `browser`, `webusb`]`-serial` library) sufficient for `require('johnny-five')` to work within browserify/webpack-ed code.

To start off, I created a couple of minimal repro repositories, steps below.
# Browserify

Browserify seems to be _mostly_  working, just with the exception of missing `mock-firmata`if users add that to `devDependencies`, it `require`s OK. Fix might just be to add `mock-firmata` to `optionalDependencies`, though I'm not sure what implications of that change might be.

Minimal repro repository: https://github.com/bcjordan/johnny-five-browserify

Repro steps:

```
git clone https://github.com/bcjordan/johnny-five-browserify.git
npm install
npm run build
```

Expected: `index.html` has a `window.five` object
Actual: error on build

title: Pin aliasing
body:
Worked on this a bit with @rwaldron.

The labels for pins on development boards don't always match up with the property names for the pins object that is passed into the constructor for various classes, i.e. [the `Led.Digits` class usage](http://johnny-five.io/api/led.digits/#usage). Because of the non-standard naming for these pin labels, it's difficult for folks who don't know how their board's pins match up with the Johnny-Five API. 

This PR allows any of the known SPI aliases for `miso`, `clk`, `ss`, `mosi` to be used in for the properties of that pins object. 

**Concerns:**
I'm not sure how to reflect this in the various docs that show `data`, `clock`, and `cs` being used for those properties. 

This will also break any uses of `ShiftRegister.pins`.

title: Add support for winch/multi-turn servo
body:
[Winch servos](http://hitecrcd.com/products/servos/boat-servos/hs-785hb-3.5-turn-winch-servo/product) are basically normal servos with a multi-turn pot. Surprisingly, not many people know about them but they can be super handy for pan-tilt things.

To control them using the standard Servo arduino library, one needs to scale the values passws to the [`write()` call](http://forum.arduino.cc/index.php?topic=120884.msg910323#msg910323). 

I could see it added as a new `type` in the `Servo` component class.

title: Support RC receivers
body:
I'd like to add a class to support traditional hobby RC receivers to control nodebots. I happen to have a Spektrum radio and compatible receivers, but other popular Tx/Rx (transmitter/receiver - common abbreviations in RC world) combinations should be supported, too.

Details of my exact setup:
DX6 Radio: http://amzn.to/1Se2hjd
AR610 Rx: http://amzn.to/1UQfqVw
(There are Spektrum compatible Tx an Rx made by Orange that are much cheaper.)

It should support individual channels (like the AR610), but also the PPM (Pulse Position Modulation) varieties. 

There are a number of examples of using these with Arduino that could get us started.
https://www.sparkfun.com/tutorials/348
http://rcarduino.blogspot.com/2012/01/how-to-read-rc-receiver-with.html

How generic should such a component be?

When my pins are [0,1,2,3] the stepper class fails with `Error: Stepper.TYPE.FOUR_WIRE expects:pins.motor1,pins.motor2,pins.motor3,pins.motor4`

when they are [4,5,6,7] it runs fine

Looking at the source: 

https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/5d3901940e20c33ab36dc710ee9cbb5ecb19de50/lib/stepper.js#L211

it's doing a ! false check instead of a typeof undefined. Pin 0 would trigger that false flag.

Is there another way to define pin 0 without it triggering a FALSE condition? I've tried 'D0' with no luck.

title: SERIAL_PORT_IDs.DEFAULT is not defined in the npm version of firmata
body:
I was getting the following error:

```
>> /Users/pawel/Projects/johnny-five/node_modules/firmata/lib/firmata.js:1541
    throw new Error("portId must be specified, see SERIAL_PORT_IDs for options.");
    ^

Error: portId must be specified, see SERIAL_PORT_IDs for options.
    at Board.serialConfig (/Users/pawel/Projects/johnny-five/node_modules/firmata/lib/firmata.js:1541:11)
    at GPS.initialize (/Users/pawel/Projects/johnny-five/lib/gps.js:276:11)
    at new GPS (/Users/pawel/Projects/johnny-five/lib/gps.js:249:10)
    at Board.<anonymous> (/Users/pawel/Projects/johnny-five/eg/gps.js:10:13)
    at emitNone (events.js:72:20)
    at Board.emit (events.js:166:7)
    at nextTickCallbackWith0Args (node.js:420:9)
    at process._tickDomainCallback (node.js:390:13)
```

It turns out that SERIAL_PORT_IDs.DEFAULT is not defined in the current version of firmata. This will fix it until that's updated.

title: Stepper motor with L298N motor driver
body:
Following the wiki guide to steppers with a driver, I am using the L298N with [this stepper motor](http://www.ebay.co.uk/itm/261985525062?_trksid=p2057872.m2749.l2649&ssPageName=STRK%3AMEBIDX%3AIT)

![http://cdn.instructables.com/F2V/3IT4/I2X6RNGR/F2V3IT4I2X6RNGR.MEDIUM.jpg](http://cdn.instructables.com/F2V/3IT4/I2X6RNGR/F2V3IT4I2X6RNGR.MEDIUM.jpg)

```
new five.Stepper({
  type: five.Stepper.TYPE.DRIVER,
  stepsPerRev: 200,
  pins: [ 11, 12 ]
});
```

**Which is the `step` and `direction` pin on that driver?** 

I'm excited by the prospect of only having to use 2 digital pins for a single stepper as I have to drive 2x stepper motors from a single Uno so the more pins I can spare the better. All other examples online use all 4 IN pins on the driver to the Ardiuno.

body:
Here's a test case:

https://gist.github.com/makenai/1047a42855cde861532d

The expected output is

```
One
Two
Three
Four
```

with a servo move to accompany each. However, it only gets to:

```
One
```

and the job stops. If you remove the second argument of `servo.to()` and don't use an animation, it works as expected.

Test is running on a single servo on pin 9, using an Arduino Uno Rev 3.

@dtex thinks this might be related to a shared queue object, and I think that makes sense.

title: Higher board timeout required when using serialport over TCP to connect to a remote board
body:
The timeout of 1e4 milliseconds for the board to become ready appears to be too short when using alternative transports, like serialport over TCP to connect to a remote board. See also https://github.com/firmata/arduino/issues/257#issuecomment-193424735

My suggestion is to make the timeout configurable as part of the board configuration. I have a working fork and I'll be happy to provide a PR for it.

title: MPR121QR2 must be soft-reset for the new sensitivity to kick in
body: Strangely, unless it has just been soft reset, the MPR121QR2 will not update the sensitivity thresholds when the `initialize()` method of the controller is called. This PR forces a soft reset anytime the controller is initialized. This is exactly what is done in the `Adafruit_MPR121::begin()` method (from the Adafruit library).

title: Added sensitivity option for MPR121QR2 (to replace hardcoded value)
Mix in controller properties for `Piezo`
body:
Allow for custom piezo controller following [led controller](https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/led/led.js#L142) property mix-in pattern. Mostly to support overriding of `setTone`/`noTone` per https://github.com/rwaldron/playground-io/pull/1, but may be of interest for #815.

@rwaldron let me know if you'd prefer I stub out more or use a different approach for mixing in, could do any of:
1. Stub out default controller behavior (add a `Controllers` map with an empty `DEFAULT`)
2. Move default piezo tone/no-tone behavior into the `DEFAULT` controller
3. Use some sort of different controller overriding pattern

TODO:
- [x] 1, 2, 3 above
- [x] Write test covering controller behavior

title: Support to SHARP GP2Y0A21 (Distance Sensor)
BNO055 calibration events and configuration options
body:
Hi,

This is just a small update that improves the calibration state of the BNO055, it now emits calibration events from the readCalibration() steps and allows a calibration mask to be supplied that allows you to alter what you consider a fully calibrated system. 

I've also updated the test as there is now an additional data event that is emitted due to the calibration now emitting. Took a while to get my head around the testing, if there is a preferred way of doing this let me know.

Cheers
John

title: Add browser-serialport dependency for NW.js support via Firmata
body:
I submitted a very similar and related pull request for the Firmata module (https://github.com/jgautier/firmata/pull/108). If both PRs are merged in, NW.js v0.13 and Johnny-Five would work together right out of the box. The huge gain is that it would no longer be necessary to custom-compile node-serialport for NW.js (which is prohibitively complicated for beginners).

With the small changes I'm suggesting in this PR and the one for Firmata, I was able to successfully use Arduino + browser-serialport + Firmata + Johnny-Five + NW.js. This is an amazingly powerful combination for physical computing and robotics.

title: Bno055
body:
This is a series of updates to the BNO module.
Includes some documentation, bug fixes, additional configuration options (crystal and chip orientation) and introduces a new orientation class that presents the absolute orientation of the sensor as Euler angles and quaternions.

Does not yet include unit configurations.

title: Add support for 5-wire servo
labels: [{'id': 315571347, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwzMTU1NzEzNDc=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Class:Servo', 'name': 'Class:Servo', 'color': '5319e7', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 12721913, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWwxMjcyMTkxMw==', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Feature', 'name': 'Feature', 'color': '02e10c', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 73075942, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw3MzA3NTk0Mg==', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Hardware%20Required', 'name': 'Hardware Required', 'color': 'eb6420', 'default': False, 'description': None}]
body:
In older electronics (particularly toys and RC vehicles), you often come across a "5-wire servo". It's actually a motor, gears, and potentiometer packaged together, much like a modern servo, but without the logic built in. When hacking on these devices and controlling them with Johnny-Five, it would be very handy to just treat it like any other servo (since functionally it is equivalent). But currently you have to re-write the logic each time to read the pot value in order to control precise position of the motor. Ideally I'd just like to use the existing Servo API.

I'm interested in this because I enjoy hacking vintage toys and I've come across this a few times. I've mentioned this in Gitter a few times (and some of you in person at hackathons), but I don't think we ever came to a consensus on the best way to handle it. Decided to create an issue to track things better.

Here is a sample of such a 5-wire servo from a Teddy Ruxpin toy that I'm working on:

![2015-06-18 22 32 13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1581285/12527587/001b743a-c14c-11e5-96ec-3f2ee7ab595d.jpg)

title: Max31850
Relay#isOn doesn't necessarily reflect whether or not it's on
body:
Upon instantiation, `Relay` sets `isOn` to `false`, which obviously has no bearing on whether or not the relay is open or closed at time of instantiation.

I was fiddling with reading the value via a method like `Pin#query()` (to avoid a bunch of unnecessary reads), but I'm not sure if this is the right way to do it, or if this is a limitation of Firmata somehow.

title: Expander MCP23017 - faulty fritzing sketches
body:
Hi, 

I am currently experimenting with the MCP23017 expander and as I am new to this, I followed the provided sketches. It took me some time to figure out the sketched are faulty:
- I2C lines are connected to the wrong pins. They need to be connected 12 & 12 instead of 11 & 12
- The hardware address pins 15 to 17 need to be grounded for default address 0x20 to achieve reliable operation. At least this was the case for my setup where the expander did not receive some commands  when the address pin were not properly grounded. This should also in line with page 8 of the datasheet as far as I understand this: "The pins must be biased externally" - see http://ww1.microchip.com/downloads/en/DeviceDoc/21952b.pdf

I'll file a PR with suggested fixture shortly.

title: GPS
body:
Note: I've edited this first comment so that it reflects the current state of the PR
### My MVPR (Minimum Viable Pull Request) for GPS.

First I should explain why I have the "Breakout", "Receivers" and "Chips" layers... 

GPS breakouts can have three physical "layers": the chip, the antenna/receiver module and the breakout board. Each of these layers are produced by different manufacturers, have their own documentation, and may or may not override and/or block functionality of the other layers by hot wiring pins or not passing them through. They can also add new functionality of their own.

We've just gotta make it all work _()_/

In GPS() chips are defined in the Chips object (which is analgous to Devices in our Device/Controller model. Breakout boards are in Breakouts and are analogous to Controllers. To handle the middle layer I've added the Receivers object. This object is applied is exactly like the Chips object. Generally, the user should just have to select a breakout board. We can figure out which module (if any) and which chip to use based on that.

These layers aren't fully utilized yet, but I've looked at many breakouts and it will be needed. Sadly I only have the Adafruit Ultimate GPS and the Tessel GPS Module. The latter is waiting on the ability to adjust the baud rate on an open port (coming soon to a firmata near you) so only the former is included in this PR.

```
/**
 * @constructor
 * @param {Object} opts Options: pin(s), device, module, controller, precision, serialport, freq
 *
 * Sample initialization
 *    new five.GPS({ pins: {rx: 10, tx: 11});
 */
```
### Methods

**GPS.sendCommand(String command)**
Sends a command to the gps chip. Line endings and checksum are automatically added.

**GPS.frequency(Number freq)**
Sets the frequency of updates in ms (default is 1000)

**GPS.restart(Boolean coldRestart)**
Restarts the GPS. If coldRestart === true the GPS will completely reset and all user configurations and previous readings will be lost. It can take the GPS 35 or more seconds to start emitting valid data again.

There are a lot of other commands we could add, but I'm not really sure they are needed. I'd rather add them when the need arises.
### Properties

**GPS.pos**
Latitude, longitude and altitude

**GPS.nav**
Course and speed

**GPS.sat**
Satellites used and precision data
### Events

**message**
Emitted when any valid message is received from the GPS.

**operations**
Emitted when the operational details change (i.e. the satellites being used)

**acknowledge**
Emitted when the GPS responds to a command

**unknown**
Emitted when an unknown message is received from the GPS

**data**
Emitted when any message is received, after the data has been updated

**change**
Emitted when lat, long, or alt has changed

**navigation**
Emitted when course, or speed has changed

Like I said, the Tessel GPS Module is coming. I've already got it working, just waiting on one new command in firmata. I know what the command API signature will be and I could go ahead and add it to tessel-io, but I'd feel more comfortable waiting for the firmata update first.

@makenai has a Spark Fun Venus GPS and he is going to look at adding support for that.

Tests are in place.

title: Add Servo.home()
body:
Returns the servo to its startAt position. 

For a single servo it's just sugar for `servo.to(servo.startAt)`

For a servo array it will return each servo to its own startAt value (handy for setting chains to their home positions).

title: Grove I2C Motor Driver support
body:
@dtex and I will work with @Legendaire to add support for these: http://www.seeedstudio.com/depot/Grove-I2C-Motor-Driver-p-907.html

From what I've learned reading through their C drivers, the motor speeds need to be set at the same time, which requires some level of coordination between the two `Motor` instances. Here's a rough sketch: 
- Implement an `Expander` controller that does the coordination and manages state persistence between two `Motor` instances. 
- Implement a `Motor` controller that exposes: 
  - `initialize` (similar to `PCA9685`)
  - `setPWM` (similar to `PCA9685`) 
  - `setPin` (similar to `EVS_EV3`)

title: Servo.home()
body:
I'm considering adding this. It would return the servo to its startAt position.

Yes, it's just sugar for:

```
servo.to(servo.startAt);
```

but it becomes really valuable in the context of a Servos collection:

```
servos.home(); // returns all servos in the array to their unique startAt positions
```

So whaddya think :+1: or :-1:?

temporal uses 100% of the CPU so on long running animations we switch to setInterval instead of temporal (after five seconds). 

Does five seconds seem good? It's completely arbitrary.

Tests look good but I still want to try with hardware so don't land this yet.

title: Q: SI7020 Revisited - i2cRead Temperature & Humidity Register
labels: [{'id': 572865816, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw1NzI4NjU4MTY=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Needs%20Response%20From%20Reporter', 'name': 'Needs Response From Reporter', 'color': 'e99695', 'default': False, 'description': None}, {'id': 631434311, 'node_id': 'MDU6TGFiZWw2MzE0MzQzMTE=', 'url': 'https://api.github.com/repos/rwaldron/johnny-five/labels/Protocol:I2C', 'name': 'Protocol:I2C', 'color': '0e8a16', 'default': False, 'description': None}]
body:
Question 1:
I am wondering why the i2cRead command for the humidity register reads three bytes for a 16-bit register value. Does the read cycle requires an extra byte to be read? I couldn't figure it from the data sheet.

https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/blob/master/lib/imu.js#L617-L620

Question 2:
During a humidity measurement the temperature is also taken and kept in register 0xE0 which serves as cache. However, if the temperature is read from register  0xE3 a new measurement will be forced. So, my question is why is register 0xE3 used instead of using the "cache" register? As far as I understand this, using register 0xE0 will halve the measurement cycles perormed.  

Question 3:
The driver reads the sensor registers at a subsecond frequency eventhough I have set the higher layer Temperature and Humidity objects to a frequency of 10000ms ("freq" property). Why is the i2c sensor read at such a high fequency? This causes a lot of traffic with the physical board (may result in higher CPU loads and network IO with remotes). It might even degrade sensor lifetime or result in degraded accuracy if the sensor heats up (this might be an issue with temperature readings in particular). Shouldn't the lowest frequency set at the higher layer constrain the read cycle of the driver?

Controlling Arduino Mega Ramps 1.4 using Johnny-five
body:
I want to control a Arduino Mega with a Ramps 1.4 shield using Johnny-five.
I uploaded the Standard Firmata the Arduino board and tried to run this code:

```
var five = require('johnny-five');
var board = new five.Board();
board.on('ready',function(){
 console.log('Board is ready');
});
```

My error:

```
1448365609699 Device(s) COM3,COM5
1448365609707 Connected COM3
 1448365619710 Device or Firmware Error A timeout occurred while connecting to the Board.
Please check that you've properly flashed the board with the correct firmware.
See: https://github.com/rwaldron/johnny-five/wiki/Getting-Started#trouble-shooting
enter code here
events.js:146
  throw err;
  ^
Error: Uncaught, unspecified "error" event. ([object Object])
at Board.emit (events.js:144:17)
at Board.log (C:\Users\Digital Hammer\Documents\Electric lab         playground\test\node_modules\johnny-five\lib\board.js:633:8)
at Board.(anonymous function) [as error] (C:\Users\Digital Hammer\Documents\Electric lab playground\test\node_modules\johnny-five\lib\board.js:644:14)
at Board.<anonymous> (C:\Users\Digital Hammer\Documents\Electric lab playground\test\node_modules\johnny-five\lib\board.js:414:14)
at Timer.listOnTimeout (timers.js:92:15)
```

I notice that my board is connected to COM5, but the connected one is COM3.
Does anyone have any ideas why it does not work?
